intro: Hieracium tapeiniforme, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. Native to Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm and produces numerous small florets in a single head. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas, where it spreads through its rhizomatous root system.
